verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>,
Sanctify<WH6942> unto me all the firstborn<WH1060>, whatsoever openeth<WH6363> the womb<WH7358> among the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, both of man<WH120> and of beast<WH929>: it is mine.

¶ And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto the people<WH5971>, Remember<WH2142> this<WH2088> day<WH3117>, in which ye came out<WH3318> from Egypt<WH4714>, out of the house<WH1004> of bondage<WH5650>; for by strength<WH2392> of hand<WH3027> the LORD<WH3068> brought you out<WH3318> from this place: there shall no leavened bread<WH2557> be eaten<WH398>.
This day<WH3117> came ye out<WH3318> in the month<WH2320> Abib<WH24>.

¶ And it shall be when the LORD<WH3068> shall bring<WH935> thee into the land<WH776> of the Canaanites<WH3669>, and the Hittites<WH2850>, and the Amorites<WH567>, and the Hivites<WH2340>, and the Jebusites<WH2983>, which he sware<WH7650> unto thy fathers<WH1> to give<WH5414> thee, a land<WH776> flowing<WH2100> with milk<WH2461> and honey<WH1706>, that thou shalt keep<WH5647> this service<WH5656> in this month<WH2320>.
Seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> thou shalt eat<WH398> unleavened bread<WH4682>, and in the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> shall be a feast<WH2282> to the LORD<WH3068>.

Unleavened bread<WH4682> shall be eaten<WH398> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>; and there shall no leavened bread<WH2557> be seen<WH7200> with thee, neither shall there be leaven<WH7603> seen<WH7200> with thee in all thy quarters<WH1366>.

¶ And thou shalt shew<WH5046> thy son<WH1121> in that day<WH3117>, saying<WH559>, This is done because of<WH5668> that<WH2088> which the LORD<WH3068> did<WH6213> unto me when I came forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>.

And it shall be for a sign<WH226> unto thee upon thine hand<WH3027>, and for a memorial<WH2146> between thine eyes<WH5869>, that the LORD's<WH3068> law<WH8451> may be in thy mouth<WH6310>: for with a strong<WH2389> hand<WH3027> hath the LORD<WH3068> brought thee out<WH3318> of Egypt<WH4714>.
Thou shalt therefore keep<WH8104> this ordinance<WH2708> in his season<WH4150> from year<WH3117> to year<WH3117>.
¶ And it shall be when the LORD<WH3068> shall bring<WH935> thee into the land<WH776> of the Canaanites<WH3669>, as he sware<WH7650> unto thee and to thy fathers<WH1>, and shall give<WH5414> it thee,

That thou shalt set apart<WH5674> unto the LORD<WH3068> all that openeth<WH6363> the matrix<WH7358>, and every firstling<WH6363> that cometh<WH7698> of a beast<WH929> which thou hast; the males<WH2145> shall be the LORD's<WH3068>.

And every firstling<WH6363> of an ass<WH2543> thou shalt redeem<WH6299> with a lamb<WH7716>; and if thou wilt not redeem<WH6299> it, then thou shalt break his neck<WH6202>: and all the firstborn<WH1060> of man<WH120> among thy children<WH1121> shalt thou redeem<WH6299>.

¶ And it shall be when thy son<WH1121> asketh<WH7592> thee in time to come<WH4279>, saying<WH559>, What is this? that thou shalt say<WH559> unto him, By strength<WH2392> of hand<WH3027> the LORD<WH3068> brought us out<WH3318> from Egypt<WH4714>, from the house<WH1004> of bondage<WH5650>:

And it came to pass, when Pharaoh<WH6547> would hardly<WH7185> let us go<WH7971>, that the LORD<WH3068> slew<WH2026> all the firstborn<WH1060> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, both the firstborn<WH1060> of man<WH120>, and the firstborn<WH1060> of beast<WH929>: therefore I sacrifice<WH2076> to the LORD<WH3068> all that openeth<WH6363> the matrix<WH7358>, being males<WH2145>; but all the firstborn<WH1060> of my children<WH1121> I redeem<WH6299>.

And it shall be for a token<WH226> upon thine hand<WH3027>, and for frontlets<WH2903> between thine eyes<WH5869>: for by strength<WH2392> of hand<WH3027> the LORD<WH3068> brought us forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>.

¶ And it came to pass, when Pharaoh<WH6547> had let the people<WH5971> go<WH7971>, that God<WH430> led<WH5148> them not through the way<WH1870> of the land<WH776> of the Philistines<WH6430>, although<WH3588> that was near<WH7138>; for God<WH430> said<WH559>, Lest peradventure the people<WH5971> repent<WH5162> when they see<WH7200> war<WH4421>, and they return<WH7725> to Egypt<WH4714>:

But God<WH430> led<WH5437> the people<WH5971> about<WH5437>, through the way<WH1870> of the wilderness<WH4057> of the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>: and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went up<WH5927> harnessed<WH2571> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

And Moses<WH4872> took<WH3947> the bones<WH6106> of Joseph<WH3130> with him: for he had straitly<WH7650> sworn<WH7650> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, God<WH430> will surely<WH6485> visit<WH6485> you; and ye shall carry up<WH5927> my bones<WH6106> away<WH5927> hence with you.
¶ And they took their journey<WH5265> from Succoth<WH5523>, and encamped<WH2583> in Etham<WH864>, in the edge<WH7097> of the wilderness<WH4057>.

And the LORD<WH3068> went<WH1980> before<WH6440> them by day<WH3119> in a pillar<WH5982> of a cloud<WH6051>, to lead<WH5148> them the way<WH1870>; and by night<WH3915> in a pillar<WH5982> of fire<WH784>, to give them light<WH215>; to go<WH3212> by day<WH3119> and night<WH3915>:
He took not away<WH4185> the pillar<WH5982> of the cloud<WH6051> by day<WH3119>, nor the pillar<WH5982> of fire<WH784> by night<WH3915>, from before<WH6440> the people<WH5971>.
